packageList.name: vapor
packageList.description: üíß A server-side Swift HTTP web framework.

latestRelease.name: Adds default file support to FileMiddleware
latestRelease.notes:
###### _This patch was authored by @NeedleInAJayStack and released by @0xTim._

<!-- üöÄ Thank you for contributing! -->

<!-- Describe your changes clearly and use examples if possible. -->

Many HTTP servers support specifying a default file when a request hits a public directory. For example, a request to `http://server.com/path/` may automatically serve the file at `path/index.html`.

This PR adds this functionality to the FileMiddleware via an initialization parameter. It defaults to disabled but can be customized to whatever default file name is desired. This default file name is also served automatically for all subdirectory queries. If the default file does not exist, the request is passed on to the next Responder.

A usage example:

```swift
// Default file serving is disabled
app.middleware.use(FileMiddleware(publicDirectory: "public/"))

// Serves `index.html` (if it exists) to a request to `http://server.com/`, as well as any subdirectories
app.middleware.use(FileMiddleware(publicDirectory: "public/", defaultFile: "index.html"))
```

Resolves: https://github.com/vapor/vapor/issues/2455

<!-- When this PR is merged, the title and body will be -->
<!-- used to generate a release automatically. -->

latestRelease.name: Improved error reporting via `DatabaseError`
latestRelease.notes:
###### _This patch was authored and released by @gwynne._

`DatabaseError`'s `isSyntaxError` and `isConnectionClosed` properties now correctly respect `MySQLError.invalidSyntax` and `MySQLError.closed` errors. A unit tests for these behaviors is included.

Also avoids double-running the FluentBenchmark tests (same change as [fluent-sqlite-driver#75](https://github.com/vapor/fluent-sqlite-driver/pull/75)).

packageList.name: console-kit
packageList.description: üíª APIs for creating interactive CLI tools.

latestRelease.name: [android] support `Android` platform.
latestRelease.notes:
###### _This patch was authored by @Guang1234567 and released by @gwynne._

Hello dev:

Just support android, thanks.


**Usage:**

```ruby
#!/usr/bin/env bash

export ANDROID_HOME=$HOME/dev_kit/sdk/android_sdk
export ANDROID_SDK=$ANDROID_HOME
export ANDROID_SDK_ROOT=$ANDROID_HOME
export ANDROID_NDK_HOME=$ANDROID_HOME/ndk/21.4.7075529
export ANDROID_NDK=$ANDROID_NDK_HOME
export NDK_ROOT=$ANDROID_NDK_HOME
export ANDROID_NDK_ROOT=$ANDROID_NDK_HOME
export ANDROID_NDK_PATH=$ANDROID_NDK_HOME
export NDK_TOOLCHAINS=$HOME/dev_kit/sdk/toolchain-wrapper

ALL_IN_ONE_FOLDER=$(dirname $(pwd))

export SWIFT_ANDROID_HOME=$ALL_IN_ONE_FOLDER/swift-android-5.4.2-release-ndk21
export SWIFT_ANDROID_ARCH=aarch64
#export SWIFT_ANDROID_ARCH=armv7
#export SWIFT_ANDROID_ARCH=x86_64
export SWIFT_ANDROID_API=23

cd console-kit

#echo -e "\n\n\nRunning on macOS:\n=======================================\n"
#swift build
#.build/x86_64-apple-macosx/debug/ConsoleKitExample demo --color --frames "‚†ã,‚†ô,‚†π,‚†∏,‚†º,‚†¥,‚†¶,‚†ß,‚†á,‚†è"

echo -e "\n\n\nRunning on androidOS:\n=======================================\n"

${SWIFT_ANDROID_HOME}/build-tools/1.9.7-swift5.4/swift-build --configuration debug -Xswiftc -DDEBUG -Xswiftc -g

echo -e "\n\n\nCopy ELF to real android device :\n_______________________________________\n"

adb push .build/aarch64-unknown-linux-android/debug/ConsoleKitExample /data/local/tmp

echo -e "\n\n\nCopy swift runtime SO to real android device :\n_______________________________________\n"

adb push ${SWIFT_ANDROID_HOME}/toolchain/usr/lib/swift/android/aarch64/*.so /data/local/tmp

echo -e "\n\n\nRunning on real android device :\n_______________________________________\n"

adb shell LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/data/local/tmp /data/local/tmp/ConsoleKitExample demo --color --frames "‚†ã,‚†ô,‚†π,‚†∏,‚†º,‚†¥,‚†¶,‚†ß,‚†á,‚†è"

cd ..

```

packageList.name: websocket-kit

latestRelease.name: Persist query parameters in WebSocket URI
latestRelease.notes:
###### _This patch was authored by @JakeTiritilli and released by @0xTim._

Prevents query parameters passed in the WebSocket URI from being silently dropped on connection (#101, fixes #94).

Calling `WebSocket.connect` with the URI `wss://localhost:443?foo=bar&bar=baz` now sends the full URI, including the query parameters, to the server.

latestRelease.name: Fix several issues with UNION query support
latestRelease.notes:
###### _This patch was authored and released by @gwynne._

- Fixes `SQLUnionBuilder` lacking `SQLQueryFetcher` conformance.
- Fixes support for SQLite.
- Adds support for `INTERSECT [DISTINCT|ALL]` and `EXCEPT [DISTINCT|ALL]` unions.
- Adds documentation for `SQLDialect` and its subtypes.
- Improves test infrastructure.

latestRelease.name: Refactor PSQLRowStream to make async/await easier
latestRelease.notes:
###### _This patch was authored and released by @fabianfett._

### Motivation

`PSQLRowStream`'s current implementation is interesting. It should be better tested and easier to follow for async/await support later.

### Changes

- Make `PSQLRowStream`'s implementation more sensible
- Add unit tests for `PSQLRowStream`

### Result

Adding async/await support becomes easier.

latestRelease.name: Add `EventLoop.performWithTask(_:)` to complement `EventLoopGroup.performWithTask(_:)`
latestRelease.notes:
###### _This patch was authored and released by @gwynne._

Additional changes:
- Reimplement `EventLoopGroup.performWithTask(_:)` in terms of `EventLoop.performWithTask(_:)`.
- Match implementations to NIO's code patterns for consistency.
- Major cleanup of AsyncKit source and tests layout (no functional changes).
- Better tests for the `performWithTask()` utilities; somehow we missed that it was originally implemented only on ELG and not EL, even though the exist test should have shown that by not even compiling successfully.
- Improvements to the CI workflows to match latest advances.

Semver-minor release due to the addition of the missing public API.

packageList.name: fluent-kit
packageList.description: Swift ORM (queries, models, and relations) for NoSQL and SQL databases

latestRelease.name: Add support for `.custom(...)` join clauses
latestRelease.notes:
###### _This patch was authored by @finestructure and released by @gwynne._

<!-- üöÄ Thank you for contributing! -->

We need to perform a `LEFT JOIN` with an additional constraint on the joined table, i.e. in SQL terms we need to execute:

```sql
LEFT JOIN "versions" AS "pre_release_version" 
ON ("packages"."id" = "pre_release_version"."package_id" AND "pre_release_version"."latest" = 'pre_release')
```

This cannot (as far as I can see) be expressed any other way, because moving the additional constraint out of the `ON` clause will effectively turn the query into an `INNER` query: either the ids match or the extra filter will reject any "outer" rows. The `LEFT JOIN` needs to happen "after" the selection, so to speak.

This PR adds an overload exposing the existing `.custom` `QueryBuilder.Join` case such that we can write this as

```swift
            let p = try Package.query(on: app.db)
                .join(Package.self,
                      PreReleaseVersion.self,
                      on: .custom(#"""
                            LEFT JOIN "versions" AS "pre_release_version"
                            ON "packages"."id" = "pre_release_version"."package_id"
                            AND "pre_release_version"."latest" = 'pre_release'
                            """#)
                )
                .all().wait()
```

(See https://github.com/SwiftPackageIndex/SwiftPackageIndex-Server/issues/1072 for some additional details.)

<!-- When this PR is merged, the title and body will be -->
<!-- used to generate a release automatically. -->

latestRelease.name: Improve error handling
latestRelease.notes:
###### _This patch was authored and released by @gwynne._

- "Connection closed" errors are now correctly reported when trying to issue queries on closed connections, instead of throwing various NIO errors.
- Query syntax errors are now explicitly reported.
- Unique constraint violation errors are now more consistently reported.

`semver-minor` due to adding a new case on `MySQLError`.

packageList.name: sqlite-nio
packageList.description: Non-blocking wrapper for libsqlite3-dev using SwiftNIO

latestRelease.name: Improve SQLite Boolean decoding
latestRelease.notes:
###### _This patch was authored by @wibed and released by @tanner0101._

Allows for a boolean field to be stored as string.

```swift
.field("is_true", .string, .required)
```
Additionally it is now its separate type, together with the other types, instead of referring to an anonymous int 
for a return, which makes It cleaner.

Before:
If the field type of a presumed boolean is set to string. it results in below error msg

```
typeMismatch(Swift.Bool, Swift.DecodingError.Context(codingPath: [], debugDescription: "Could not initialize Bool from \"0\".", underlyingError: nil))
```

packageList.name: fluent-mongo-driver
packageList.description: MongoDB support for Fluent built on MongoKittten.

latestRelease.name: Upgrade MongoKitten Version
latestRelease.notes:
###### _This patch was authored by @qi-shun-wang and released by @0xTim._

When receiving a lot of MongoDB traffic (millions of requests), a small leak in MongoKitten would become a performance and memory problems in services. This patch depends on the MongoKitten version with that fix.

See: https://github.com/OpenKitten/MongoKitten/issues/254
